newsitem.title: USA: NYSE says to suspend, delist Lehigh Group.
newsitem.headline: NYSE says to suspend, delist Lehigh Group.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said on Monday that it would suspend trading in the common stock of Lehigh Group Inc before the opening of trading on July 10, or earlier if Lehigh began trading in another securities market place.

The exchange also said the company has advised the NYSE that it is seeking to transfer the trading of its shares to another marketplace and that following its suspension it will apply to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to delist the issue.
The NYSE said the decision was based on the fact that the company fell below its continued listing criteria.

In addition, the exchange noted that Lehigh's proposed merger with and into First Medical Corp, if approved, would result in a combined entity that did not meet the exchange's original listing requirements.
